## What is RStudio server?

"RStudio Server enables you to run the RStudio IDE you know and love on a Linux server, accessed from your web browser, bringing the power and productivity of the RStudio IDE to a centralized server-based environment."

## RStudio on DASH

The RStudio deployment on DASH is attached to Databricks clusters and storage.

## Accessing RStudio server

Access to RStudio server is through Databricks.  
Use the URL you have been given and login with your credentials.  

On the left hand menu select "Compute"

```{r, echo = FALSE, out.width = '100%'}
knitr::include_graphics("images/RSS1.png", dpi = NA)
```

Select a cluster from the list by clicking on it's name.  
Make sure the cluster has a green tick in the "State" column to the left of the name. This indicates it is running, or "spun up". 

```{r, echo = FALSE, out.width = '100%'}
knitr::include_graphics("images/RSS2.png", dpi = NA)
```

Select the app "Apps" at the top of the page. 


```{r, echo = FALSE, out.width = '40%'}
knitr::include_graphics("images/RSS3.png", dpi = NA)
```

Click the "Show password" text.  
Double click the password to highlight it then copy it.  
(Right click and slect copy from menu or ctl-c)


```{r, echo = FALSE, out.width = '40%'}
knitr::include_graphics("images/RSS4.png", dpi = NA)
```

Click the "open RStuido" text.  
Log in with your DASH username and the copied password.
